text: The threats that were made against HBCUs across this nation today, including Southern University here at home, were unacceptable and quite frankly, shameful. No student should ever have to fear for their safety while at school, and no parent should send their child off to college and fear they might get a lockdown call. This was wrong, disruptive, and those responsible should be held accountable.

The tragic death of Charlie Kirk is a reminder of the painful moment our country is living through. No matter our political differences, violence is unacceptable and has no place at all in our democracy. My thoughts and prayers are with Charlie Kirk’s family, especially his wife and children, as they mourn this loss.

I joined my Congressional Black Caucus colleagues to send one clear message: our constituents deserve to be heard, counted, and fairly represented. The redistricting fight is about nothing less than our democracy. https://t.co/BdROf2Txsz

Watch my interview with Blake Burman of The Hill on NewsNation here. Deploying the National Guard to cities is a great disservice to the men and women who sacrifice so much to serve our country. Their duty is to defend the nation, not replace local law enforcement. https://t.co/7l9QIjeQHb

Fair representation is not optional. It is a constitutional right, and I will fight to make certain ALL Louisiana citizens are never denied their rightful seat at the table of democracy. https://t.co/Wf5K9Zylzv
TONIGHT at 6 PM ET, Congressman Fields will join The Hill on NewsNation’s own, Blake Burman, to discuss crime in our nation. Don’t miss it! https://t.co/S9KHqTp2hZ
https://t.co/Hbw3Fh1CKU
https://t.co/kaJJhXik5T

Thank you, Lafayette Parish for giving me so much to take back to Washington. From redevelopment talks at Northgate Mall and a visit to the Holy Rosary Institute Project, to community stops at SMILE Community Center Project and Acadians CARES, and lunch at Creole Lunch House. We ended the day with a powerful town hall covered by C-SPAN. Communities like this are what make Louisiana’s 6th District Strong. Keep showing up and remain engaged! #6thdistrictlisteningtour #LA06

Yesterday, I had the chance to visit Southwest LA Primary Healthcare Center, tour the fabrication plant opening in Washington, LA, met with Acadian Medical Center’s team, and had meaningful conversations around economic development.

Thank you to all the elected officials of St. Landry Parish for the hard work that you do for our constituents. I will continue to fight just as hard in Washington to make sure you all have the resources and opportunities St. Landry needs to thrive.
#6thdistrictlisteningtour #LA06

Today was a reminder that good policy starts with listening and good conversations. Thank you to the CENLA Chamber of Commerce, CENLA Broadcasting, and the great people of Central Louisiana for your engagement and insight on what matters. #6thdistrictlisteningtour #LA06 https://t.co/nQOjHHC1RO

I had the pleasure of spending time with not one but two amazing senior communities of EBR Council on Aging this week: first at the Leo S. Butler Center and today at the Lotus Village. Every visit with them is a reminder of the wisdom, joy and resilience our seniors bring to the heart of Louisiana. I’ll always be a voice for them in Congress and in our communities. #LA06 #EBRCOA

With significant rainfall expected across our district through Saturday, I urge all residents to take precautions now. 

✅ Clear debris from drains and gutters
✅ Avoid driving through flooded roadways
✅ Pay attention to local news and emergency alerts 

My office is monitoring updates and will keep you informed. Please stay safe and check on your neighbors.

I’m back in DC with my boots on the ground to vote NO on the President’s “Big Ugly Bill.” Louisiana, I hear your concerns and I’m here to represent you as I vote no on this bill! https://t.co/nD7JjieEoL

The Senate just passed the “Big Ugly Bill” that will take away healthcare benefits for over 11.8 million hard-working Americans and increase the deficit by $3.3 trillion just to give tax breaks to the wealthy.

I just flew back into Washington to vote NO on this “Big Ugly Bill” when it gets to the House floor.

What a joy it was to join our seniors for Senior Skip Day with the EBR Council on Aging. Behind every laugh and dance move was a reminder of why this work matters. I’ll always stand up for the policies that put our seniors first. https://t.co/DeRZGHcuMC

The seat I currently hold was created by the Louisiana legislature last January. Today we were expecting the Supreme Court to rule on whether the current map will be in place for the remainder of this decade. 

Unfortunately the Supreme Court did not issue a final ruling and will rehear the case during their next term. I look forward to continuing to serve the people of Louisiana’s 6th congressional district.

I have been consistent in my belief that America should not be entangled in the Iran-Israel conflict. The recent news of U.S. air strikes only deepens our involvement in a war that does not serve the best interests of the American people. 

Our priority should be diplomacy and de-escalation.  We must focus on the pressing needs of our citizens here at home. We cannot afford to be drawn into yet another endless conflict.

Thank you to everyone who joined me in Alexandria for last night’s town hall meeting. Let’s keep the momentum going! Next stop: Mansfield, LA. If you’re in the area, join me TODAY at noon at the Clista Calhoun Center. https://t.co/x2fHpMdubB

As we celebrate Juneteenth, we reflect on the perseverance of those who came before us and recommit ourselves to a future rooted in hope, unity, and justice. We show that commitment not just in our words, but in our actions every single day. #Juneteenth

Our town hall in West Baton Rouge was a tremendous success. I’m grateful for everyone who showed up, spoke up, and shared their passion, especially about the future of our children’s education. I hear you and I’m ready to keep fighting alongside you. Stay engaged, stay vocal, and let’s keep working together to build the Louisiana our children deserve.

It was an honor to stand with @buildbatonrouge, @BRECParks, Councilwoman Carolyn Coleman, Republic Services, and community members today for the ribbon cutting of Erie Street EcoPark. This new green space is a testament to what can be accomplished when we work together to invest in families and our neighborhoods.

As a father of two sons, I know firsthand the joy, responsibility, and love that comes with raising a family. Today, I join you in celebrating the fathers, grandfathers, uncles, and father figures who pour into their families and communities every single day. https://t.co/VMlevTImSr
DeSoto, Rapides, and West Baton Rouge, I hope to see you all there! #LA06 #JuneTownHallSeries https://t.co/sZGw7ZIUeH

Today, I had the pleasure of welcoming Kearra Grisby, the winner of my district’s Congressional Art Competition, to the Capitol.

Her art piece entitled “Crown” will be on display in the tunnels of the US Capitol for a year! I’m incredibly proud of Kearra and all of the talented young people from my district who submitted their artwork.
People who fail to learn from history will end up repeating it. I hope you learn something from these two videos and the powerful example of these two great leaders. https://t.co/2vqC5KXLtf

Job Corps serves the young people in every state and community, no matter Republican or Democrat, who want to make an honest living with the resources they have. 

We must stand with our students. https://t.co/4vYdbkluGy
Thank you, Avoyelles and Pointe Coupee for showing up to share your concerns with me. Let’s keep pushing for progress! #LA06 #TownHall https://t.co/BulpZMYwW0

Thank you to The Advocate for allowing me to write about the importance of protecting Medicaid. I encourage everyone to check out the full article at their website. 

I hear your concerns and I’ll never stop fighting for you!

https://t.co/gJ6xIgPw1O

Avoyelles and Pointe Coupee, I’m coming your way! There’s big work happening in Washington, and I want to give you the latest updates. More importantly, I want to hear from you. Join me at a town hall near you! https://t.co/oRvXzT7sEu

This Memorial Day, we remember the men and women who gave their lives in defense of our nation out of duty, conviction, and live for a country they believed could be better. Let this day call us not only to remembrance, but to responsibility to ensure this nation remains worthy of their sacrifice.

I wanted to take a minute to personally congratulate the Class of 2025. Congratulations graduates! There’s a lot going on in the world, but don’t let anything hold you back. You can do whatever you set your mind to! https://t.co/XIsLHRDWo4
There is nothing beautiful about a bill that could strip vital healthcare and food assistance from millions of Americans. https://t.co/yCSyTPHBcA

I’ve been up all night fighting to protect the right to healthcare for the people of Louisiana. I may be tired, but I will never be too tired to stand up for my state. 

Keep calling and letting your voices be heard. We need boots on the ground. I’m here and I’ll be here as long as it takes.

It’s now 1:00am and we won’t sit silent while the rich get tax cuts, but American families lose their healthcare and children go hungry. This is unacceptable. That is why I am standing with my good friend, @rep_jackson to fight for the healthcare of our seniors and children with disabilities. The fight begins now and we are willing to stay up all night to see to it that working families win. #savemedicaid #saveSNAP #saveourchildren #saveourseniors

Most people will be asleep, but I won’t because, Republicans will be trying to cut Medicaid by $880 billion in the dead of the night. At 1 am, I will be in the Rules Committee fighting for Louisiana families. Stay tuned. https://t.co/805TC1u7hG

Members of Congress have the right and responsibility of oversight. My colleague, Rep. LaMonica Mclver was doing her job, overseeing the conditions of an ICE detention facility in her district, when she was arrested and charged. Today, I joined members of the Congressional Black Caucus, the Democratic Women’s Caucus, and the Congressional Progressive Caucus to say, “We stand with you Congresswomen Mclver.” No one should fear arrest or prosecution for doing their job.
@RepLaMonica
Madam Mayor, it was great speaking with you about how we can work to bring resources back to Lafayette. I’m excited for all of the projects this great city has in the works! https://t.co/KcjLrViL4w

The thoughts and prayers of myself, my family, and my staff are with President Biden and his loved ones following his cancer diagnosis. Just like he’s spent his career fighting for the American people, I know he will fight this as well.

Today I spoke on the House floor to honor the life of former Mayor Melvin “Kip” Holden. Mayor Holden will be deeply missed by those who knew him, and by the city of Baton Rouge. https://t.co/vDbnJdWzgt

Today, we honor the life and legacy of former Mayor-President Melvin “Kip” Holden.

Mayor Holden was a trailblazer, a history-maker, and a dedicated public servant who helped shape the future of Baton Rouge as we know it. As the first African American to lead the City-Parish, he broke barriers and built bridges, always putting people first. His contributions will forever leave a lasting mark on Baton Rouge and beyond.

My thoughts and prayers are with his family, friends, and all those who were touched by his leadership.

Here’s a look at some of the things that happen during my day in Congress.

First, I was greeted by an energetic group of young constituents from Louisiana coming to tour the Capitol. After that, the American Kidney Fund came in to discuss legislation about organ donation and how we can stop End-Stage Kidney disease.

Later the Radiological Society of Louisiana informed me about some upcoming legislation that will provide more cost-effective care to patients. Additionally, I had a great meeting discussing vessel infrastructure and channel maintenance with the Port of Lake Charles.

Today I met with members of the Pulmonary Hypertension Association to learn more about the work that the SOAR Act will do to expand access to supplemental oxygen for those who need it most. 

This bill is bipartisan and bicameral which means there is support from both parties in both chambers.

Today I was humbled to be presented with the State Legislative Champion award for Early Childhood Education. I have spent decades advocating for our children but there is still so much more we can do!

Thank you to this incredible group of childcare professionals and educators from coming together to discuss what Congress can do to support early childhood education in Louisiana and across America.

Thank you to Sandra Dave from the National Breast Cancer Coalition for coming by my office to discuss the importance of funding for breast cancer research and breast cancer screening. https://t.co/uD7VYK9oL8

This morning I had the pleasure of meeting with members of the leadership team from Lane Regional Medical Center. We discussed Medicaid funding and support for the 340B Drug Pricing Program which aims to make pharmaceuticals more affordable. https://t.co/N1JWmZxnCt

President Trump’s first 100 days in office have been disappointing to say the least. While we hold out hope for things to improve, the courts and Congress should exercise checks and balances. https://t.co/UF3HPGjVDN

“Today my office was informed that ICE will be restoring approximately 1500 student visas. This decision comes following both a multitude of legal challenges and a direct letter that I sent to Secretary of State Marco Rubio, Secretary of Homeland Security Kristi Noem, and Acting Director of U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement Todd Lyons requesting a review and detailed explanation of this administration’s decision to terminate several visas for students at Southern University.
 
At this time, it is confirmed that a number of the international students from Southern University, for whom my office has been working tirelessly on their behalf, have had their student visas restored. While I’m glad this situation is getting resolved, these sudden and unfounded decisions by the Trump administration continue to cause unnecessary confusion and hardship for students, schools, and families. I look forward to working with this Congress and this administration to continue fighting for students in my district and throughout this country. ”

Over a month ago I stood on the House steps with my fellow Democrats, listening to the stories of people whose lives would be up ended if they lost their Medicaid cover coverage. Today, we’re still fighting to #SaveMedicaid. https://t.co/WfJ0WvVcCX

The talent on display today was incredible! I had a great time at our district’s 2025 Congressional Art Competition Awards Event. Every piece was unique and powerful. I would like to congratulate our winners:

1st Place: Kearra Grisby, “Crown” 
(St. Joseph’s Academy)

2nd Place: Kimora Franklin, “Spirit Realm” 
(McKinley Senior High School)

3rd Place: Kai-Li Thomas, “Brown Girl Gazing” 
(McKinley Senior High School)

Honorable Mention: Kristian Richard, “Stronger Together” 
(Home School)

To all the young artists who participated this year, thank you for sharing your gifts. Your creativity and passion for the arts truly blew me away. You are the next generation of creatives, and I am proud to have had the opportunity to celebrate that today. Thank you to our wonderful judges, the dedicated instructors who nurture these young talents, and the proud parents who cheer them on every step of the way.

Today I spoke on the House floor to stand up for Louisiana against those who want to eliminate overdraft protections. 

The Consumer Financial Protection 
Bureau finalized a rule in December 2024 to stop excessive overdraft fees by big banks, requiring them to cap fees at $5. Eliminating this cap would only further hurt people when they’re down.

Today I sent a letter to President Trump expressing how concerned I am about the impact of his tariffs.  

Louisiana, I hear your frustrations and I am working hard to do everything in my power to stand up for you. https://t.co/5QzEbqXgxu
Read my full statement at https://t.co/YjJovOg5uK. https://t.co/HK9LoLMFAN

I am excited to co-host tomorrow’s @WTFShow2025 alongside my good friend and colleague, @rep_jackson for an important discussion on Voting Rights and the SAVE Act. We’ll break down what this means for our nation and why it matters now more than ever to protect our democracy through your voices being heard. Don’t miss it!
 
Tune in LIVE TOMORROW at 9 AM CST and be part of the conversation!

Calling all young artists! A reminder that the deadline for the 2025 Congressional Art Competition is swiftly approaching. April 4th is your chance to showcase your talent and have your artwork displayed in the U.S. Capitol!

Don’t miss your chance to be recognized on a national stage! Submit your artwork to my Baton Rouge office by 5 PM CST on April 4th for consideration. 

For details on how to enter, visit https://t.co/MmkYj5nXtV 

Have more questions? Contact our Baton Rouge office at (225) 952-1965. 

I can’t wait to see the amazing talent from Louisiana’s 6th District! #2025CongressionalArtCompetition

A federal judge has blocked the Trump Administration’s attempt to dismantle the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau (CFPB), a critical agency that has returned over $21 billion to Americans. I proudly joined over 200 of my colleagues in defending the CFPB, because protecting consumers from financial fraud is non-negotiable. This ruling is a major win for the millions of hardworking families it protects! #ProtectConsumers #CFPB #StandingForYou

Meaningful time this week with the outstanding women of Delta Sigma Theta Sorority, Incorporated, an organization rooted in sisterhood, scholarship, service, and social action. 

For over a century, Delta Sigma Theta has been a driving force for change, empowering communities and advocating for progress. Grateful for their dedication and the lasting impact they continue to make. #D4WomenInAction #D4WIA

President Trump's tariff policies directly contradict his Day One inflation promises and are imposing significant financial hardships on Louisiana families and Main Street businesses in my district. Through my position on the Financial Services Committee, @RepBynum , @RepLiccardo and I are exercising our constitutional oversight responsibilities to challenge these misguided economic measures and advance common-sense legislation that will provide much-needed relief to hardworking Americans across our great nation.

Baton Rouge, I hear you, I feel the same frustration, and I want you to know that I’m doing everything I can to push for REAL solutions. The challenges we are facing in Washington can only be conquered if we all stand together. Your voices fuel this fight, and I won’t stop working to deliver the change our state and this nation deserves. Thank you for showing up and unapologetically speaking out. #LA06

President Trump plans to sign an executive order today to dismantle the Department of Education, special education funding, civil rights protections for our students, and more on the line.

I will not stand by while our children’s futures are put on the chopping block and erased. We must fight back because, education is not a privilege. It’s a right! 
#IStandWithTheDepartmentofEd

Louisiana, it’s our time to shine! Wishing all our teams the best in this year’s 2025 NCAA Basketball Tournament, especially our Lady Jags 🐆! Let’s bring it home! #GoJags #GeauxTigers #GeauxPokes https://t.co/K1plQRTfoy

Natchitoches, I am incredibly grateful for your meaningful discussions at last night’s town hall. I understand many of you are frustrated, and there is no doubt our democracy is in trouble. As your Congressman, I am committed to ensuring that the voices and needs of everyone in District 6 are represented in Washington.

Opelousas, thank you to everyone who attended last night’s town hall! It was an honor to hear your concerns, ideas, and perspectives. Your voices are the driving force behind meaningful change, and I’m grateful for the opportunity to serve you. #LA06

Stay tuned for tonight’s town hall in Natchitoches, LA and join live from Facebook! @CongressmanCleoFields

Louisiana, I want to hear from YOU! Next week, I’ll be hosting town hall meetings across LA-06 to discuss the issues that matter most to our communities. From healthcare and education to jobs and disaster relief, your voice is critical in shaping the future of our district.

Can’t attend in person? Join me LIVE on Instagram @repcleofields_! Let’s work together to build a stronger Louisiana. See you there!

Today, I stood on the House floor to honor the life and legacy of my dear friend, Congressman Sylvester Turner. A tireless advocate for education, infrastructure, and social justice, his impact on Texas and our nation will never be forgotten. My thoughts and prayers are with his family, loved ones, and all those mourning this tremendous loss.

Deeply saddened by the sudden loss of Congressman Sylvester Turner. I send my deepest sympathy and prayer to the Turner family, Congressman Turner’s staff, the city of Houston, and the state of Texas during this difficult time. https://t.co/s2ZYRIk5ab

At tonight’s Presidential Joint Address to Congress, Congressman Fields will be joined by Kennedy Orr, President of Southern University’s Student Government Association. She has traveled throughout Capitol Hill today advocating for more affordable opportunities in education and continued funding to programs like the Pell Grant. At Southern University, it’s estimated that 74% of students receive some kind of Pell Grant assistance.

More than 200 members of Congress in the House are submitting an amicus brief to back a lawsuit that aims to prevent the dismantling of the CFPB. Protecting working-class Americans from unfair financial practices is essential. 

I stand with my fellow colleagues in supporting the CFPB and its mission to safeguard families’ savings, financial security, and consumer rights. We must ensure a fair and stable economy for everyone. #ProtectCFPB

“America should always stand strongly and firmly with its allies. 

I am hopeful that the Trump Administration and Ukraine can overcome today’s dispute and get back on track to solve this crisis within the region for the betterment of all.”

- Congressman Cleo Fields

I am truly devastated to hear of the untimely and tragic passing of Caleb Wilson, a beloved Southern University student and member of the Human Jukebox, whose life was cut far too short. My heart goes out to all who knew and loved him. The loss of this bright and talented young man is deeply felt by us all, and I pray for comfort and strength for his family, friends, and the entire Jaguar Nation.

Today, I stood alongside House Democratic Leader Hakeem Jeffries and my fellow House Democrats to stand firmly against the proposed cuts to Medicaid. We cannot afford to let down the millions of people who rely on programs like Medicaid for survival. https://t.co/Vg17pNas2l

Congressman Fields is currently in a Financial Services Committee hearing, where members are examining the challenges posed by China across a range of policy tools, such as China’s dominance as an official creditor and its development of cutting-edge technologies. https://t.co/F8zoIk6efd

I’m thrilled to announce that the Louisiana Department of Environmental Quality has received $2.4 MILLION in funding through the Sewer Overflow and Stormwater Reuse Municipal Grant Program. This grant will go toward planning, designing, and constructing vital water quality improvement and protection projects in our community. Congratulations to LDEQ on this investment in our environment and our future! #CleanWater #CommunityInvestment #LDEQ

Proud to stand with @rep_jackson and @repsturner as Co-Chairs of the Diversity, Equity, & Inclusion Caucus, where we will continue the work of protecting workers' rights, promoting inclusive policies, and raising awareness about the importance of these values. Diversity makes us stronger. Equity ensures fairness. Inclusion builds unity. Together, we are committed to building a future where every voice is heard and every person has a seat at the table.
#DiversityEquityInclusionCaucus

Alexandria, thank you for a very honest and engaging town hall. So many of you shared that this was the first time in a long time that your Congressman has come to meet with you in person, and I am committed to making sure it won’t be the last. 

I heard your concerns loud and clear, and I plan to use them to push for real solutions. #LA06
Thank you to everyone who joined me at last night’s Lafayette town hall meeting! Let’s keep the conversation going as we work together for a better Louisiana! #LA06 https://t.co/i5PDEjLon1

Tonight, I had the privilege of hosting our first town hall meeting of District 6. With the many concerns regarding the challenging times our nation is currently facing, I am committed to continuing these important conversations. 

Moving forward, I will be conducting monthly town hall meetings throughout our district to ensure open dialogue and transparency. To everyone who participated, thank you for your engagement, ideas, and sharing your interests #LA06

- CF

81% of voters, both Republicans and Democrats, support the CFPB and want the agency to continue its work. Protecting vulnerable communities is the CFPB’s mission, and I’ll always fight to ensure it can put workers and consumers first. #CFPBWorks

This morning, Congressman Fields sat down with @LiamCombs3 of “On the Record with Liam Combs” to discuss topics such as the start of his political career and the concerns that many have about the decisions of the Trump Administration and what they mean for Louisiana families and our nation. 

Congressman Fields is working tirelessly every day on Capitol Hill to make sure your voice is heard. Stay tuned for the full episode! #OnTheRecordWithLiamCombs #LA06

I hope you will join me on Monday, February 17, 2025 at 10:00 AM in the Southern University F.G. Clark Activity Center as Democratic Leader @RepJeffries administers the ceremonial oath of office at my District Swearing-In Ceremony. https://t.co/X5KL7YH7o5

I know you’ve got a lot to tell me and I want to listen. In order to best serve the people of Louisiana, I am encouraging all of my constituents to attend one of the town hall meetings I will be hosting next week. Come out to make your voices heard.

No concern is too big or too small and I hope to hear as many as possible next week. #LA06

Reflecting on my journey from Baton Rouge to Congress, I’m honored to share my story with C-SPAN this month. Join me as I discuss the experiences that shaped my path and the reasons behind my return to public service. Today, I join President Biden and other fellow leaders in New Orleans for a solemn evening of prayer in remembrance of all the victims of the New Year’s Day tragedy. We remain committed to working toward meaningful support for the families as we stand united in grief and resolve.
